snippet: Thousands of Egyptians protested in Tahrir Square on Friday amid anxiety over the upcoming presidential runoff and fears that former President Hosni Mubarak’s conviction will be reversed.
abstract: Demonstrators gather in Tahrir Square in Cairo to rally against the candidacy of Ahmed Shafik, former military commander, for president; protesters are threatening to boycott the vote, infuriating supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood candidate Mohamed Morsi.
lead_paragraph: Thousands of Egyptians protested in Tahrir Square on Friday amid anxiety over the upcoming presidential runoff and fears that former President Hosni Mubarak’s conviction will be reversed.

headline.seo: Protesters Gather in Cairo Amid Escalating Tensions
headline.main: Protesters Gather in Cairo Amid Escalating Tensions
headline.print_headline: Protesters Gather in Cairo Amid Escalating Tensions
